Diin  apil niini ang himoong Proficiency Exam alang sa mga ICT Professional, Cyber Security, Digital Literacy, Digital trainings ug uban pa. Ang selebrasyon  sa IC…

posts.poster: Center for Digital Iligan, Innovation & Sustainability
posts.title: Center for Digital Iligan, Innovation & Sustainability
posts.description: The National ICT Month Celebration in Iligan City officially commenced through a kickoff ceremony led by Mayor Frederick Siao, Chairman of the Iligan ICT Council, and the Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT). With the national theme “Walang Iwanan sa Digital Bayanihan,” this year’s celebration focuses on inclusive and collaborative digital transformation—ensuring that all communities benefit from digital innovation. In his message highlight, Mr. Paul Hui, Executive Director of the Iligan ICT Council, City Consultant on Innovation Governance and head of the Center for Digital Iligan, Innovation & Sustainability (CDIIS), emphasized the city’s commitment to building industry-aligned digital ecosystems. Throughout June, the city will host various activities aligned with its Digital Cities Program, including digital skills training, innovation forums, and technology showcases—driven by the collaborative efforts of LGU Iligan, DICT, DTI, academe, and the private sector. #DigitalBayanihan #NICTM2025 #ICTMonth2025

posts.description: 𝗡𝗢𝗪 𝗛𝗔𝗣𝗣𝗘𝗡𝗜𝗡𝗚, DEVCON Kids: MBots Workshop – Batch 1 at the HUB! Let’s build the future—one block of code at a time.

title: Introduction to Vibe Coding: Building with AI
description: The Digital Creatives Hub – Iligan hosted Introduction to Vibe Coding: Building with AI — a beginner-friendly session that welcomed participants into the world of AI-assisted development.

posts.title: Digital Creatives Hub Iligan
posts.description: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗩𝗶𝗯𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗧𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝗢𝗳𝗳 𝗮𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗛𝘂𝗯 The Digital Creatives Hub – Iligan hosted Introduction to Vibe Coding: Building with AI — a beginner-friendly session that welcomed participants into the world of AI-assisted development. Led by Mr. Alexander Burias, AI Consultant at Daloy Tech OPC and CTO/CEO of Tag Sing Co., the session explored how tools like Gemini and bolt.new allow users to create a landing page for a website using just natural language prompts — no coding experience needed. As part of the activity, participants were able to build their own landing pages by giving specific prompts, gaining hands-on experience in using AI to generate layouts and design structures. This session served as an introductory training, sparking interest for deeper workshops that will cover how to make websites work — including button functionality, page linking, and interactive components. Organized by DEVCON Iligan through the DEVCON Kids Program, the event is part of ICT Month 2025, in partnership with the City Government of Iligan under Mayor Frederick Siao, DICT Iligan, the ICTC Department, and the Center for Digital Iligan, Innovation & Sustainability (CDIIS).
